meanings.definition: Blood that has been shed, especially as a result of violence.
meanings.sent1: The horror movie was full of gore and made me cover my eyes.
meanings.sent2: The crime scene was covered in gore, a chilling sight for the investigators.
meanings.sent3: The Halloween costume was so realistic with fake gore that it scared everyone at the party.
meanings.sent4: The artist used red paint to create a painting that resembled the gore of a battlefield.
meanings.sent5: The documentary showed the brutal reality of war with graphic images of gore.

meanings.definition: A triangular piece of material inserted in a garment to make it wider or more full.
meanings.sent1: The dress had beautiful lace gore sewn into the skirt for added elegance.
meanings.sent2: The tailor added a gore to the dress to give it a more flowing silhouette.
meanings.sent3: The costume designer used a colorful gore to enhance the flare of the dancer's outfit.
meanings.sent4: The fashion designer's new collection featured gowns with intricate gored details.
meanings.sent5: The historical costume had elaborate gores that added volume and movement to the dress.

meanings.definition: To pierce or stab with a horn or tusk.
meanings.sent1: The bull tried to gore the matador with its horns during the intense bullfight.
meanings.sent2: The rhinoceros can gore predators with its powerful horn when threatened.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous unicorn pretended to gore its friends with its magical horn.
meanings.sent4: The warrior's spear was like a deadly horn ready to gore any enemy in battle.
meanings.sent5: The charging buffalo attempted to gore anything in its path with its sharp horns.
